item.title: Introducing AXIOM: A Self-Sustaining AI Agent on Base
item.description: I'm building an autonomous AI agent that earns, saves, invests, and posts receipts. Here's the high-level architecture.

item.title: The Road to Hershey Starts Now
item.description: PIAA individual postseason kicks off this weekend. My freshman is making his first run. Here's how it works and why I'm a wreck.

item.title: Base Just Broke Up With Optimism at ETHDenver
item.description: Base drops the OP Stack, OP token dumps 20%, and ETHDenver 2026 is somehow both tiny and chaotic. Here's what happened.

item.title: Hello Again, World
item.description: The prodigal blog returns. Five years of radio silence, explained poorly.

item.title: Projects
item.description:
I have a lot of projects in different states of being unfinished. This page is designed for me to start cleaning up these projects and publishing them mainly for my own peace of mind.

AXIOM

A fully autonomous, self-sustaining AI economic agent. AXIOM lives on X, earns income by selling services (analysis, writing, NFT generation) for ETH micropayments on Base, and manages its own treasury across liquid ETH, yield on Morpho Blue, and investments. The target is a $30k treasury generating ~8% APY to cover all operating costs indefinitely â€” no human intervention required.

item.title: My New Hugo Site
item.description:
Hello World

My name is Dan Worth and you can read more about me @ the about page.

Let’s see how this goes

I, like many in my profession have tried to maintain a website/blog but rarely keep it updated. This is my attempt to have a place where I’ll actually post things I’m working on or thinking about to help me flesh out my ideas and thoughts.

I like Golang so naturally I picked Hugo as my static site generator. So far it’s pretty nice and I liked the varienty of themes. I tend to be pretty minimailistic in my approach to things so I’m using the simplest theme I could find. Simpleness 😄
